title: Turning AI Into Practical Solutions with OPAQUE
text:
Turning AI Into Practical Solutions

Accenture is a global professional services company that helps businesses solve complex problems, using innovative solutions to help organizations adapt to today’s fast-changing business environment. Accenture stands out by making advanced technologies like AI usable in real-world settings. They provide full support to clients, from identifying key AI opportunities to building secure, scalable models that integrate smoothly into existing operations.

With the growing amount of sensitive data and the need for AI systems to work in multi-party environments, ensuring data security is a big challenge. To address these needs, Accenture leverages cutting-edge hardware like NVIDIA’s H100 Tensor Core GPUs alongside OPAQUE's confidential computing technologies. This powerful combination enables businesses to safely implement AI projects while ensuring scalability, data privacy, and regulatory compliance.

"Through our collaboration with OPAQUE, we are empowering companies to navigate complex data landscapes with confidence, ensuring that privacy remains a priority even as they advance their capabilities."

The Challenge: Ensuring Data Privacy During AI Deployment

Trusted AI depends on trusted data. Companies manage huge amounts of personal, financial, and proprietary data. As the data grows, securely analyzing it becomes essential—not only for maintaining customer trust and complying with legal requirements but also for unlocking the full value of data for insights. However, analyzing sensitive data, especially when shared between multiple parties, is a challenge. Strict regulations and technological limitations make it hard to collaborate securely. Data silos within organizations add to the problem, making it difficult to share and analyze data across departments or external partners. This results in missed opportunities and prevents businesses from fully leveraging AI. In industries with heavy regulation, the need to maintain data security while using AI becomes even more critical. Accenture needed a way to harness the power of large datasets while ensuring innovation and security were not compromised.

The Solution: Secure AI for Complex Data Environments

To address these issues, Accenture partnered with OPAQUE, whose platform allows multiple organizations to share and analyze sensitive data securely. OPAQUE’s confidential AI technology ensures that data remains encrypted during processing, allowing organizations to collaborate without exposing or decrypting sensitive information. With this partnership, Accenture and its clients can confidently move AI projects into production, knowing that compliance and data security are maintained. This collaboration removes barriers that previously restricted the full use of valuable data.

"Our collaboration with OPAQUE has transformed how we support businesses in managing sensitive data. Using confidential AI technology, we are enabling companies to gain valuable insights and push the boundaries of what’s possible in a responsible and forward-thinking manner."

The Results: Unlocking AI’s Potential

Telecommunications: Improved Data Sharing and Cyber Threat Response.

Accenture works with leading telecommunications companies to help them share data securely across departments and with partners. Opaque’s secure multi-party computation (SMPC) technology allows these companies to perform computations on encrypted data without exposing sensitive information. By partnering with OPAQUE, Accenture enables telecom providers to collaborate securely on tasks like fraud prevention and network optimization. For example, multiple telecom companies can combine their data to detect patterns of fraudulent activity, while ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations and keeping proprietary information protected.

"At Accenture, our focus is on driving innovation while adhering to the highest standards of security and compliance. With confidential AI technology, we can help industries access and leverage sensitive data that was previously out of reach, all while preserving data sovereignty and privacy."

"Our collaboration with OPAQUE has opened new opportunities for companies and reinforced trust in data ecosystems."

Enhancing Know Your Customer (KYC) Programs

In the retail sector, Accenture helps clients securely analyze customer data without exposing sensitive information. By leveraging OPAQUE’s confidential computing platform, Accenture enables retailers to collaborate with third-party partners or internal departments to gain deeper insights into customer behavior. This secure approach allows retailers to create more personalized marketing campaigns and improve the shopping experience. For instance, a retailer might work with a payment processor to analyze purchasing patterns, gaining valuable insights while ensuring individual customer privacy is maintained.

Conclusion: Innovation With Confidence

By integrating OPAQUE's technologies, Accenture has solved data protection challenges, enabling clients to innovate and grow while ensuring data security in an increasingly data-driven world.

title: RiskStream Collaborative and OPAQUE Team Up to Fight Insurance Fraud
text:
Insurance fraud is a major industry challenge

With the FBI and National Insurance Crime Bureau (NICB) estimating the total cost of non-health insurance fraud at more than $40 billion per year. Fraudsters often take advantage of the highly fragmented nature of the industry.

Knowing that—due to data privacy limitations—individual insurers can typically only analyze their own data rather than pooling and analyzing it to identify potential patterns of fraudulent activity. Because fraudsters use blind spots to carry out criminal activity, exchanging loss incident data between disparate insurers is often mission-critical to successfully identifying and mitigating fraud attempts.

RiskStream Collaborative, the insurance industry’s largest blockchain consortium, is on a mission to provide this essential capability with RAPID X, a blockchain-powered auto claims data platform that facilitates claims data exchange between multiple insurance carriers to better detect and prevent fraudulent activity, from auto fraud to workers’ compensation fraud.

When building RAPID X, RiskStream had to create a robust foundation for data exchange between insurance carriers that was both secure and compliant with privacy laws and regulations. Collaborative members needed to have the assurance that their data would be encrypted and confidential when pooled with other members’ data; otherwise, no company or insurer would trust and utilize the solution.

“If you’re unable to look at any sensitive data at all—even name, or date of birth—it handcuffs your ability to see patterns and flag potential fraud. Improving the amount of data that you have secure access to is incredibly important: if you’re only analyzing your own data, you’re extremely limited in the insights you can get,” explained Eric Phillips, director of product operations at RiskStream Collaborative.

Existing solutions for data pooling and collaboration—including data masking and anonymization—proved to be time-consuming, inefficient, and even detrimental to the value of the data. RiskStream needed a platform that could ensure data would remain encrypted, protected, and unchanged throughout its entire lifecycle, empowering insurers to harness the benefits of collaborative analysis without modifying existing workflows. At the same time, RiskStream also needed that solution to integrate seamlessly into their systems to maximize efficiency.

“As a collaborative, we had the unique opportunity to help mitigate this existential threat, but we couldn’t do it on our own,” Phillips said. “We needed a solution that would help us securely share data without fears of leakages or breaches.”

Multiple collaborative members recommended Opaque, a confidential AI provider, as the right platform to enable secure multiparty data sharing and guarantee ease of use, ownership, and interoperability.

Secure Multiparty Data Sharing

OPAQUE enables secure multiparty data sharing via its Confidential AI platform.

With OPAQUE, collaborative members can now stream encrypted data directly from RAPID X into OPAQUE via API in near-real time without exposing it to any other party. Members can also run pre-approved, confidential analyses in OPAQUE to compare each claim against a claims database from all carriers who opt in (with all claims remaining encrypted during the analysis).

Carriers can also calculate a fraud score for each claim and notify others when the fraud score exceeds a threshold through RAPID X. Ultimately, insights are derived from the joint analyses, without ever exposing the raw data: carriers can only see insights regarding their own claims. This guarantees that sensitive information remains protected, addressing both regulatory and competitive concerns.

With OPAQUE, collaborative members have dramatically increased their speed of intervention and flagging of potential fraudulent activity. By detecting fraud more quickly and accurately, these carriers can reduce the financial losses associated with fraudulent claims—knowing that security, privacy, and compliance are baked into the solution.

“Our members didn’t even know that this was possible. It was eye-opening to work with OPAQUE and start educating our members on the platform and its capabilities,” according to Phillips. “Opaque is perfectly suited to help solve the problems that the insurance industry faces fighting fraud—while doing so in a safe, private, encrypted manner.”

“Opaque is perfectly suited to help solve the problems that the insurance industry faces fighting fraud—while doing so in a safe, private, encrypted manner.”

Ease of Use, Ownership, & Interoperability

OPAQUE proved to be a turnkey business application: the product was integrated quickly, connecting systems smoothly and enabling RiskStream to feed data directly into OPAQUE’s platform via existing technology. It took only two weeks to set up the platform, enabling RiskStream to avoid laborious and developer-heavy customization.

“OPAQUE’s solution was fairly off the shelf—it only took a little customization,” Phillips explained. “I was extremely impressed. We were on a bit of a time crunch, so to meet that deliverable in such a short amount of time absolutely exceeded our expectations.”

Once implemented, OPAQUE’s user-friendly platform empowered RiskStream to be the workspace manager, able to add or remove others into the workspace and set custom rules. This has ensured security, privacy, and total trustworthiness between members.

Collaborative members have been effusive in their praise for OPAQUE’s customer service, citing their efficiency in responding to technical questions. For RiskStream, OPAQUE is a strategic, valued partner, offering thought leadership and expertise on how to solve ongoing challenges.

For more information about the RiskStream Collaborative, or questions about RAPID X, please visit https://www.riskstream.org, or contact [email protected].

title: Unlocking Enterprise AI at Scale: ServiceNow x Opaque
text:
ServiceNow, a leader in digital workflow automation

Is committed to transforming the way enterprises operate by building cutting-edge AI solutions that streamline business processes, enhance employee experiences, and drive operational efficiency.

However, the challenge of scaling AI across the enterprise while managing sensitive data, ensuring compliance, and maintaining control over fragmented information posed significant hurdles. To overcome these challenges, ServiceNow sought a partner that could provide robust privacy protections and seamless data management — enter Opaque Systems.

ServiceNow partnered with OPAQUE Systems to enhance its AI solutions by leveraging confidential computing technologies to solve critical data privacy and management challenges. This collaboration allowed ServiceNow's Digital Technology (DT) division to streamline processes, increase operational efficiency, and enhance employee experiences while ensuring data security.

One of the main hurdles in productizing AI within enterprise environments is dealing with sensitive data, fragmented systems, and ownership concerns. ServiceNow turned to OPAQUE's secure, LLM-enabled service to navigate these obstacles. This service enables seamless access to interconnected data while preserving privacy, access control, and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.

Through this collaboration, ServiceNow benefited from faster time to production, decreased deployment and maintenance costs, and enhanced data privacy and compliance — key differentiators that set the company apart. OPAQUE’s technology integrates smoothly into ServiceNow’s architecture, making it scalable and efficient, while reducing operational risk by maintaining provable compliance with both internal governance policies and external regulations.

This integration also enables improved employee experiences using generative AI, powered by OPAQUE’s secure system. ServiceNow’s employees, for example, can access real-time insights and faster responses by leveraging Opaque’s confidential AI platform to query and process data efficiently, ensuring both performance and privacy in an ever-connected workplace.

The partnership between ServiceNow and OPAQUE

Highlights how confidential AI can unlock new opportunities for businesses looking to scale AI while safeguarding sensitive information.

OPAQUE’s secure, scalable architecture not only addresses the technical challenges of AI deployment but also ensures compliance with internal and external regulations. This collaboration is a prime example of how forward-thinking enterprises like ServiceNow can achieve innovation and growth without compromising data privacy or operational integrity.

"ServiceNow works closely with Microsoft, NVIDIA, and OPAQUE to put AI to work for people and deliver great experiences to both customers and employees on the Now Platform."
- Kellie Romack, Chief Digital Information Officer

"The partnership between OPAQUE and Microsoft allows us to quickly deploy and leverage the power of Azure confidential VMs with NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPUs to deliver confidential AI with verifiable data privacy and security."
- Kellie Romack, Chief Digital Information Officer

title: Unlocking AI-Powered Software Development with Confidential Data: Bloomfilter x OPAQUE
text:
Bloomfilter, a leader in AI-driven process mining for the software development lifecycle (SDLC), empowers technology leaders to uncover bottlenecks, reduce risk, and drive better business outcomes. Their platform provides deep visibility into every stage of the SDLC by ingesting and analyzing data from tools like Jira and GitHub, surfacing actionable insights for teams and executives alike.

However, as Bloomfilter expanded its suite to include large language models and advanced AI features, questions about data privacy, security, and intellectual property risk became critical barriers, especially for blue-chip enterprise clients.

By partnering with OPAQUE, Bloomfilter was able to deliver provable guarantees of data privacy and sovereignty, accelerate enterprise adoption of their most advanced AI features, and unlock new value for their customers. In just weeks, Bloomfilter saw sales cycles contract, enterprise objections dissolve, and platform “stickiness” rise as clients embraced capabilities once held back by security concerns. Today, Bloomfilter delivers on its mission with the confidence that customer data—and business reputations—are protected by confidential AI.

Bloomfilter: Bringing Clarity and Control to the SDLC

Modern software development is a labyrinth of tasks, tools, and stakeholders. CTOs and product leaders crave transparency—into costs, bottlenecks, rework, and risks—but siloed data and legacy processes keep these answers out of reach. Bloomfilter set out to change that by providing AI-powered process mining and analytics for the SDLC, connecting the dots from code commits to business outcomes.

"With Bloomfilter, we can surface where teams lose momentum—down to specific processes and bottlenecks. Our CTOs value that the data stays private and in our control, even as we unlock insights for both engineering and product. Now, both teams align on what’s slowing us down and how to fix it, all with audit-ready security in place." — Andrew Wolfe, Co-Founder and Co-CEO, Bloomfilter

As Bloomfilter’s features evolved—especially with AI-powered risk analysis and generative insights—so did the stakes. Clients began to ask: How can we be sure our sensitive data is safe from leaks, competitive threats, and emerging AI attack vectors?

The Challenge: Data Privacy, AI Risk, and Adoption Barriers

Bloomfilter’s most innovative AI features required ingesting and analyzing customer data from systems like Jira and GitHub—data that often includes intellectual property, known software vulnerabilities, user stories, and more. Security-conscious clients, especially in highly regulated sectors, raised concerns about:

- Potential intellectual property leakage
- Data exhaust being weaponized via AI
- Compliance with strict privacy mandates
- Losing control over how and where data was processed by third-party models

These concerns led to drawn-out security reviews, delayed deals, and in some cases, customers disabling Bloomfilter’s most valuable AI-powered features.

"Some clients loved our AI roadmap but refused to activate key features due to privacy concerns. We realized our growth and renewal rates were at risk if we couldn’t provide airtight assurances." — Andrew Wolfe, Co-Founder and Co-CEO, Bloomfilter

The Solution: Confidential AI with OPAQUE

Bloomfilter turned to OPAQUE’s confidential computing platform to give customers the robust, audit-ready privacy guarantees they demanded—without sacrificing performance, agility, or time-to-value. With a focus on enabling confidential agents for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), Bloomfilter could now offer its most advanced AI capabilities while maintaining strict data privacy controls.

Working closely with OPAQUE's customer success team, Bloomfilter was able to:

- Deploy AI workloads—including confidential agents for retrieval-augmented generation—in secure, confidential environments (on Azure and beyond)
- Integrate rapidly via an Azure Marketplace package, rolling out pilot implementations in days
- Showcase architecture diagrams that proved customer data would remain private—even across multi-cloud deployments
- Eliminate the need for code rewrites, accelerating time to adoption

With OPAQUE, Bloomfilter could assure clients: their data, models, and analysis outputs remained encrypted and strictly controlled at every stage.

The Results: Faster Deals, Full Adoption, and Business Growth

The impact was both immediate and measurable:

- Sales Conversion: Bloomfilter saw a 57% increase in sales conversion rates on large enterprise pursuits.
- Sales Cycle: Security review time dropped by 32%, shaving an average of 28 days off new deals.
- AI Feature Adoption: The share of customers activating Bloomfilter’s most advanced AI features jumped from 46% to over 90%—with full adoption now in sight.
- Platform Stickiness: Engagement metrics shifted from monthly to daily active usage as customers embraced AI-powered insights.

After OPAQUE launched, the response was immediate. CTOs who needed hybrid deployments unlocked full access with private, vendor-agnostic integrations. CIOs dropped their privacy objections as soon as automated, tamper-proof audits landed on their desks.

"Our technical stakeholders kept telling us, ‘We’re finally able to use confidential AI without compromising our environment or losing control of our data.’ Once those hurdles dropped, adoption soared. Even our most risk-conscious clients are using every feature, and we’re seeing daily engagement numbers we never hit before." — Erik Severinghaus, Co-Founder and Co-CEO at Bloomfilter

Equally important, Bloomfilter now positions itself as a privacy-first innovator, earning the trust of both technical and business leaders.

Looking Ahead

Today, Bloomfilter and OPAQUE continue to collaborate on next-generation features, such as confidential agents for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), deepening the value proposition for enterprise customers. The result: Bloomfilter’s clients can innovate with confidence, accelerate time-to-value from AI, and protect the sensitive data at the heart of their businesses.

Bloomfilter’s partnership with OPAQUE exemplifies how forward-thinking SaaS leaders are turning privacy and security from obstacles into powerful enablers for growth, adoption, and differentiation in the era of AI.

Good privacy practices aren’t just policies—they’re what bring customers back and help your business grow. Experience how OPAQUE makes trust a core part of the way you work. Request your demo and start the conversation.
